page.title: 17Knowle High Street
page.content: Knowle High St. is quite a busy high street. Still left on the High Street are two inns:The Red Lion and The White Swan. On the High Street there are some very modern and slighly older buildings. Passing through Knowle High Street every day are about 500 cars and lorries per hour. From the Churchyard you can see the two inns. The White Swan has now been converted into a bank and the Red Lion is a pub. You can also see the Guild House shich is timber framed and built in the 1400's. Also from the churchyard you can see: Covent Garden,An Electrical Store, and a Butchers. All those buildings look quite old except for Covent Garden which is a new building Traffic Survey: 3.00-3.35pm-------47 Cars----1 Lorry{ 6.00-6.05pm-------30 Cars----2 Lorries
